Description: THE MISSISSIPPI NATIONAL RIVER AND RECREATION AREA IS RICH WITH HISTORICAL AND CULTURAL STORIES. THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES ASSISTANCE AND OR FUNDS TO ENHANCE PARTNER ORGANIZATION PLANNING FOR AND INTERPRETATION OF NON-FEDERAL PUBLICLY OWNED LANDS WITHIN THE RECREATIONAL AREA. THIS PROJECT RESTRICTS MINNEHAHA OFF-LEASH DOG PARK USERS TO THE DESIGNATED DOG PARK AREA BY FENCING THE RIVERSIDE DOG PARK THAT IS CURRENTLY ONLY PARTIALLY FENCED AND EDUCATING DOG PARK USERS OF THE REQUIREMENT TO KEEP THEIR DOGS LEASHED OUTSIDE THE DOG PARK. THIS PROJECT PREVENTS BANK EROSION, NATURAL RESOURCE DAMAGE AND VISITOR CONFLICTS BY OFF-LEASH DOGS OUTSIDE THE DESIGNATED DOG PARK AREA. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE STATE OF MINNESOTA OR ITS POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, COUNTIES, CITIES, AND NON-PROFITS.

THE MISSISSIPPI NATIONAL RIVER AND RECREATION AREA IS RICH WITH HISTORICAL AND CULTURAL STORIES. THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES ASSISTANCE AND ORSTATE FUNDS TO ENHANCE PARTNER ORGANIZATION PLANNING FOR AND INTERPRETATION OF NON-FEDERAL PUBLICLY OWNED LANDS WITHIN THE RECREATIONAL AREA. THIS PROJECT CONVERTS AN EXISTING AT-GRADE, MID-BLOCK REGIONAL TRAIL CROSSING INTO A GRADE-SEPARATED CROSSING VIA A 14 WIDE, 10 HIGH CONCRETE BOX CULVERT AND INCLUDES REALIGNING 1,900 OF THE EXISTING REGIONAL TRAIL TO IMPROVE SAFE ACCESS TO AND THROUGH THE MISSISSIPPI NATIONAL RIVER RECREATION AREA (MISS). BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS.

THE MISSISSIPPI NATIONAL RIVER AND RECREATION AREA STATE AND LOCAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO ENHANCE PUBLIC ENJOYMENT OF THE MISSISSIPPI NATIONAL RIVER AND RECREATION AREA WHICH IS RICH IN HISTORICAL AND CULTURAL STORIES  THIS PROJECT WILL EXPAND ON THE PADDLE SHARE PROGRAM WITH PURCHASES OF TWO KAYAK STORAGE LOCKERS TO BE USED IN THE PADDLE SHARE  PADDLESHARE ORG  KAYAK SHARING SYSTEM  PUBLIC PARTICIPANTS WILL NOT NEED A VEHICLE TO USE THE KAYAK SYSTEM WHILE ACCESSING THE MULTIPLE ROUTES ON THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER  BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE STATE, LOCAL, THE STATE OF MINNESOTA OR ITS POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, COUNTIES, CITIES, NON PROFITS

PURPOSE OF AWARD  SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT   THIS PROJECT IS PART OF THE MISSISSIPPI NATIONAL RIVER AND RECREATION AREA S FIVE YEAR ALTERNATIVE TRANSPORTATION PLAN, WHICH SEEKS TO CREATE A CONTINUOUS NON MOTORIZED TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE 72 MILE PARK CORRIDOR WITH EMPHASIS ON OFF ROAD BIKE TRAILS SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES  THIS PROJECT INCLUDES THE DEVELOPMENT OF A TRAILHEAD FACILITY ALONG THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER GREENWAY AT THE WAKOTA BRIDGE I 494 LOCATION IN SOUTH ST  PAUL, MINNESOTA  THE FACILITY WOULD PROVIDE FULL SERVICE RESTROOMS, PICNIC FACILITIES, INTERPRETATION, AND IMPROVED PARKING PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES  THIS PROJECT WILL LINK NON MOTORIZED TRAILS FROM THE I 494  WAKOTA BRIDGE TRAIL TO THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER REGIONAL TRAIL AND PROVIDE AMENITIES AT A KEY JUNCTURE FOR THESE TRAILS  NON MOTORIZED RECREATIONAL AND COMMUTER USE WILL BE SUPPORTED YEAR ROUND AS THE TRAILS WILL BE PLOWED AND MAINTAINED IN ALL SEASONS BENEFICIARIES  THE STATE OF MINNESOTA OR ITS POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, COUNTIES, CITIES, NON PROFITS

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE MISSISSIPPI NATIONAL RIVER AND RECREATION AREA IS RICH WITH HISTORICAL AND CULTURAL STORIES. THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES ASSISTANCE AND/OR FUNDS TO ENHANCE PARTNER ORGANIZATION PLANNING FOR AN INTERPRETATION OF NON-FEDERAL PUBLICLY OWNED LANDS WITHIN THE RECREATIONAL AREA.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: DEVELOPMENT OF THE ROSEMOUNT EAST SEGMENT OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER TRAIL IN ROSEMOUNT, MINNESOTA, CLOSES A GAP IN THE PLANNED TRAIL TO PROVIDE A FULL CONNECTION WITHIN THE MISSISSIPPI NATIONAL RIVER AND RECREATION AREA BETWEEN SOUTH ST. PAUL AND HASTINGS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: COMPLETION OF THE TRAIL IN DAKOTA COUNTY WILL NOT ONLY PROVIDE A SIGNATURE RECREATIONAL EXPERIENCE AND ALTERNATIVE TRANSPORTATION OPTION FOR RESIDENTS, BUT WILL ALSO PLAY A KEY ROLE IN ADVANCING THE CREATION OF A REGIONAL- AND NATIONAL-SCALE DESTINATION TRAIL.BENEFICIARIES: STATE, LOCAL (THE STATE OF MINNESOTA OR ITS POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, COUNTIES, CITIES, NON-PROFITS).
